docs.title: Dotfiles Keybindings Documentation
docs.text: Welcome to the comprehensive keyboard shortcuts documentation for my personal development environment.

docs.title: Quick Navigation
docs.text:
• Neovim

    Text editor with LSP, Telescope, and custom plugins

    View shortcuts

  • tmux

    Terminal multiplexer with vim-style navigation

    View shortcuts

  • AeroSpace

    i3-like window manager for macOS

    View shortcuts

  • yazi

    Terminal file manager with DuckDB integration

    View shortcuts

  • Cursor

    AI-powered IDE with Vim mode

    View shortcuts

  • IdeaVim

    IntelliJ IDEA Vim emulation

    View shortcuts

  • zsh

    Shell configuration with vi mode

    View shortcuts

  • Glove80

    Split ergonomic keyboard with Engrammer layout

    View layout

docs.title: Shared Patterns
docs.text:
All tools follow consistent keybinding patterns:

Pattern Keys Purpose Leader Key Space Primary command prefix (Neovim, IdeaVim, Cursor) Window Navigation Ctrl+H Ctrl+J Ctrl+K Ctrl+L Vim-style directional movement Search Operations Space+S+* Telescope-style search (files, grep, symbols) LSP Actions Space+G+* Go to definition/references/implementation Refactoring Space+R+* Rename, extract, refactor operations

docs.title: Quick Reference
docs.text: Looking for a specific shortcut? Check the Quick Reference page for cross-tool comparisons.

docs.title: About This Documentation
docs.text:
This site is automatically generated from dotfiles configurations and deployed via GitHub Actions.

  • Repository: czechue/.dotfiles
  • Last Updated: Auto-updated on each push to master
  • Tools: MkDocs Material, List.js, GitHub Actions

docs.title: About
docs.text: This documentation site provides a comprehensive reference for all keyboard shortcuts across my personal dotfiles configuration.

docs.title: Tools Documented
docs.text:
• Neovim: Text editor based on Kickstart.nvim with lazy.nvim plugin manager
  • tmux: Terminal multiplexer with vim-style navigation
  • AeroSpace: i3-like tiling window manager for macOS
  • yazi: Terminal file manager with DuckDB plugin
  • Cursor: AI-powered IDE with Vim mode
  • IdeaVim: Vim emulation for IntelliJ IDEA
  • zsh: Shell with vi mode and custom functions

docs.title: Technology Stack
docs.text:
• MkDocs Material: Documentation framework
  • pymdownx.keys: Keyboard shortcut rendering
  • List.js: Interactive table search and filtering
  • GitHub Actions: Automated deployment

docs.title: Deployment
docs.text: This documentation is automatically deployed to GitHub Pages when changes are pushed to the master branch.

docs.title: Deployment Process
docs.text:
1. Push changes to master branch
  2. GitHub Actions workflow triggers (.github/workflows/docs.yml)
  3. Workflow installs Python and MkDocs Material
  4. Site builds with mkdocs build --strict
  5. Deploys to gh-pages branch with mkdocs gh-deploy
  6. GitHub Pages serves the site at https://czechue.github.io/.dotfiles/

docs.title: Manual Deployment
docs.text:
You can also deploy manually from your local machine:

# Install dependencies
pip install -r requirements.txt

# Build and deploy
mkdocs gh-deploy

docs.title: GitHub Pages Settings
docs.text: In the repository settings, GitHub Pages should be configured to: - Source: Deploy from gh-pages branch - Folder: / (root) - Custom domain: None (using default GitHub Pages URL)

docs.title: Repository Structure
docs.text:
.dotfiles/
├── docs/              # Documentation source (this site)
├── nvim/             # Neovim configuration
├── tmux/             # tmux configuration
├── aerospace/        # AeroSpace configuration
├── yazi/             # yazi configuration
├── cursor/           # Cursor IDE settings
├── ideavim/          # IdeaVim configuration
└── zsh/              # zsh configuration

docs.title: Updating Documentation
docs.text:
Documentation is maintained manually and can be updated by:

  1. Editing Markdown files in docs/ directory
  2. Running mkdocs serve to preview locally
  3. Committing changes to master branch
  4. GitHub Actions automatically deploys to GitHub Pages

docs.title: License
docs.text: Personal dotfiles repository. Configuration patterns may be freely adapted for personal use.

docs.title: Contact
docs.text:
• GitHub: @czechue
  • Repository: czechue/.dotfiles

docs.title: Quick Reference
docs.text: Unified view of keyboard shortcuts across all tools with cross-tool comparisons.

docs.title: Window Navigation (Ctrl+HJKL)
docs.text:
Available in: Neovim, tmux (with prefix), AeroSpace (Ctrl+Alt+HJKL), Cursor, IdeaVim

Tool Left Down Up Right Notes Neovim Ctrl+H Ctrl+J Ctrl+K Ctrl+L Direct navigation tmux Ctrl+B+H Ctrl+B+J Ctrl+B+K Ctrl+B+L Requires prefix AeroSpace Ctrl+Alt+H Ctrl+Alt+J Ctrl+Alt+K Ctrl+Alt+L System-wide Cursor Ctrl+H Ctrl+J Ctrl+K Ctrl+L Vim mode IdeaVim Ctrl+H Ctrl+J Ctrl+K Ctrl+L Vim emulation

docs.title: Search Operations (Leader+S+*)
docs.text:
Available in: Neovim, Cursor, IdeaVim

Action Neovim Cursor IdeaVim Find Files Space+S+F Space+S+F Space+S+F Grep/Search Space+S+G Space+S+G Space+S+G Symbols Space+S+H Space+S+S Space+S+S Recent Files Space+S+R Space+S+R Space+S+R

docs.text:

Action Neovim Cursor IdeaVim Go to Definition G+D Space+G+D Space+G+D Go to References G+R - - Go to Implementation G+Shift+I Space+G+I Space+G+I Rename Space+R+N Space+R+N Space+R+N Code Action Space+C+A Space+C+A Space+C+A

docs.title: All Shortcuts Search
docs.text:
Use the search box below to find shortcuts across all tools:

Shortcut Action Tool Context Ctrl+H Navigate left Neovim Window Navigation Ctrl+H Navigate left Cursor Window Navigation Ctrl+H Navigate left IdeaVim Window Navigation Ctrl+B+H Select pane left tmux Pane Navigation Ctrl+Alt+H Focus left AeroSpace Window Focus H Parent directory yazi Navigation Space+S+F Search files Neovim Telescope Space+S+F Quick open Cursor Search Space+S+F Go to file IdeaVim Search Space+G+G LazyGit Neovim Git Ctrl+B+Shift+G LazyGit popup tmux Git Ctrl+F tmux-sessionizer Multiple Project Switching Alt+1 through Alt+9 Switch workspace AeroSpace Workspace 1 through 9 Switch tab yazi Tabs Space+A Add to Harpoon Neovim File Management Space+H Harpoon menu Neovim File Management G+D Go to definition Neovim LSP Space+G+D Go to definition Cursor/IdeaVim LSP Space+R+N Rename Multiple LSP Space+C+A Code action Multiple LSP

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
• Leader Key: Most Vim-style tools use Space as the leader
  • Prefix Key: tmux uses Ctrl+B as the prefix for all commands
  • System-Wide: AeroSpace keybindings work across all applications
  • Context-Aware: Some shortcuts behave differently in different modes

docs.title: Symbol Layer - Glove80
docs.text: Detailed reference for the Symbol layer, optimized for programming and text editing.

docs.title: Layer Overview
docs.text:
The Symbol layer provides quick access to all programming symbols without requiring Shift modifiers. It's designed to keep your hands in the home position while typing code.

Activation: Hold the Symbol key on the right thumb cluster (Space key position on base layer).

docs.title: Top Row (Number Row Position)
docs.text: Position Key Description Grave ` Backtick for markdown, command substitution Comma , Comma (direct access) Left Paren ( Opening parenthesis Right Paren ) Closing parenthesis Semi ; Semicolon Dot . Period/dot

docs.title: Home Row 1 (Q-T Position)
docs.text: Position Key Description Exclaim ! Exclamation mark, logical NOT Left Bracket [ Opening square bracket, arrays Left Brace { Opening curly brace, blocks Right Brace } Closing curly brace Right Bracket ] Closing square bracket Question ? Question mark, ternary operator

docs.title: Home Row 2 (A-G Position)
docs.text: Position Key Description Hash # Hash/pound, comments, preprocessor Caret ^ Caret, XOR operator, regex start Equal = Assignment operator Underscore _ Underscore, variable names Dollar $ Dollar sign, variables, jQuery Asterisk * Asterisk, multiply, pointers

docs.title: Bottom Row (Z-B Position)
docs.text: Position Key Description Tilde ~ Tilde, home directory, bitwise NOT Less Than < Less than, HTML tags, redirects Pipe \| Pipe, OR operator, shell pipes Minus - Minus/hyphen, subtract Greater Than > Greater than, arrows, redirects Forward Slash / Forward slash, divide, paths

docs.title: Thumb Cluster (Left)
docs.text: Position Key Description Transparent ▽ Pass through to base layer Ampersand & Ampersand, AND operator, references Single Quote ' Single quote, strings, char literals Double Quote " Double quote, strings Plus + Plus, add, concatenate

docs.title: Top Row (Number Row Position)
docs.text: Position Key Description All ▽ Transparent - pass through

docs.title: Home Row 1 (Y-P Position)
docs.text: Position Key Description Grave ` Backtick (mirrored) Delete Del Forward delete Shift+Tab ⇧Tab Reverse tab, outdent Insert Ins Insert mode toggle Escape Esc Escape, cancel Transparent ▽ Pass through

docs.title: Home Row 2 (H-; Position)
docs.text: Position Key Description Double Quote " Double quote (mirrored) Backspace ⌫ Delete backward Tab ⇥ Tab, indent Space ␣ Space (direct access) Enter ↩ Return/Enter Transparent ▽ Pass through

docs.title: Bottom Row (N-/ Position)
docs.text: Position Key Description Single Quote ' Single quote (mirrored) Cmd/GUI ⌘ Command key (macOS) / Super (Linux) Ctrl ⌃ Control modifier Alt ⌥ Alt/Option modifier Shift ⇧ Shift modifier Transparent ▽ Pass through

docs.title: Thumb Cluster (Right)
docs.text: Position Key Description Backslash \ Backslash, escape character Dot . Dot/period Asterisk * Asterisk (mirrored) All Others ▽ Transparent - pass through

docs.title: Brackets and Braces
docs.text: All bracket types are on the left hand for easy access: - Round: ( ) on number row - Square: [ ] on top home row - Curly: { } on top home row - Angle: < > on bottom row

docs.title: Operators
docs.text: Mathematical and logical operators grouped by function: - Arithmetic: + - * / on left hand - Comparison: < > = on left hand - Logical: ! & | on left hand - Bitwise: ^ ~ & | on left hand

docs.title: String Delimiters
docs.text: All quote types accessible: - Single: ' on left thumb or right middle - Double: " on left thumb or right index - Backtick: ` on left top or right top

docs.title: Special Characters
docs.text: Programming-specific symbols: - Hash: # for comments, preprocessor, CSS IDs - Dollar: $ for variables, shell, jQuery - At: @ for decorators, email, mentions - Underscore: _ for snake_case, private members - Question: ? for ternary, optionals, regex

docs.title: Usage Tips
docs.text:
1. Keep Fingers on Home Row: The most common symbols are positioned to minimize finger travel
  2. Symmetric Design: Common editing operations (Backspace, Delete, Tab, Space, Enter) mirrored on right hand
  3. Modifier Access: Right hand provides Shift, Ctrl, Alt, Cmd for easy key combinations
  4. Pair Programming: Brackets and quotes are positioned to allow quick pair insertion

docs.title: Most Used Symbols (Programming)
docs.text: Symbol Location Use Case = Left Index (Home) Assignment ( ) Left Top Row Function calls { } Left Top Row Code blocks [ ] Left Top Row Arrays, indexing " ' Left Thumb / Right Hand Strings ; Left Top Row Statement end . Left Top Row / Right Bottom Member access * Left Home / Right Thumb Multiply, pointers / Left Bottom / Right Bottom Divide, comments

docs.title: Editing Operations
docs.text:
Action Location Shortcut Delete Forward Right Top Del Delete Backward Right Home ⌫ Indent Right Home ⇥ Outdent Right Top ⇧⇥ Cancel Right Top Esc

← Back to Glove80 Overview

docs.title: Glove80 Keyboard
docs.text:
The MoErgo Glove80 is a split ergonomic keyboard with 80 keys, powered by ZMK firmware. This configuration uses a simplified 4-layer setup optimized for development work.

Keymap File: glove80/glove80-simple.keymap

docs.title: QWERTY Layer
docs.text:
The base typing layer with standard QWERTY layout. Key features:

  • F-keys Row: F1-F10 function keys across the top
  • Number Row: Numbers 1-0 with symbols (=, )
  • Alpha Keys: Standard QWERTY letter layout
  • Modifiers: Caps Lock, Shift keys on home positions
  • Arrow Cluster: Dedicated arrow keys in center (↑↓←→)
  • Thumb Clusters:
  • Left: Navigation (Home, PgUp, PgDn, End) + Layer access (Cursor, Number)
  • Right: Layer access (Symbol) + Modifiers (Alt) + Brackets

docs.title: Number Layer
docs.text:
Numeric keypad and function keys layer, activated via thumb key. Optimized for:

  • Right Hand Number Pad: Traditional numpad layout (7-8-9, 4-5-6, 1-2-3, 0)
  • Arithmetic Operators: +, -, *, / positioned around the numpad
  • Symbols: Mathematical and programming symbols (^, #, $, !, ~, |)
  • Special Characters: <, >, (, ), [, ], =
  • Left Hand: Modifiers (Shift, Cmd, Alt, Ctrl) for easy shortcuts

Perfect for spreadsheet work, calculator-style number entry, and mathematical expressions.

docs.title: Cursor/Navigation Layer
docs.text:
Navigation and browser control layer. Features:

  • Arrow Keys: Vim-style navigation (←↓↑→) on right hand home row
  • Page Navigation: Home, End, PgUp, PgDn on right hand
  • Modifiers: Easy access to Shift, Cmd, Alt, Ctrl on left hand
  • Common Actions: Backspace, Delete, Tab, Space, Enter, Esc
  • Left Hand: Mirror positioning for symmetric operation

Ideal for browsing documentation, navigating code, and text selection.

docs.title: Symbol Layer
docs.text:
Programming symbols and special characters - See detailed guide

Quick access to:

  • Brackets: (), [], {}, <>
  • Operators: =, +, -, *, /, |, &, ^
  • Punctuation: !, ?, @, #, $, %
  • Quotes: ', ", `, ~
  • Special: \, /, ;, :, ,, .

docs.title: Customization
docs.text: To modify your Glove80 layout:

docs.title: 1. Edit the Keymap
docs.text:
# Edit simplified keymap
vim glove80/glove80-simple.keymap

docs.title: 2. Regenerate Visualizations
docs.text:
# Parse keymap to YAML
python -m keymap_drawer -c glove80/config.yaml parse -z glove80/glove80-simple.keymap -o glove80/parsed.yaml

# Fix layout name
sed -i '' 's/glove80-simple/glove80/' glove80/parsed.yaml

# Generate individual layer SVGs
python -m keymap_drawer -c glove80/config.yaml draw glove80/parsed.yaml -s QWERTY -o glove80/qwerty.svg
python -m keymap_drawer -c glove80/config.yaml draw glove80/parsed.yaml -s Symbol -o glove80/symbol.svg
python -m keymap_drawer -c glove80/config.yaml draw glove80/parsed.yaml -s Number -o glove80/number.svg
python -m keymap_drawer -c glove80/config.yaml draw glove80/parsed.yaml -s Cursor -o glove80/cursor.svg

# Copy to docs
cp glove80/{qwerty,symbol,number,cursor}.svg docs/keyboard/

# Preview
mkdocs serve

docs.title: 3. Deploy
docs.text:
git add . && git commit -m "docs: update glove80 visualization"
git push  # Triggers GitHub Actions deployment

docs.title: References
docs.text:
• Config: .dotfiles/glove80/
  • Keymap File: glove80-simple.keymap
  • Style Config: glove80/config.yaml (minimal config with default styles)
  • Visualization: Generated with keymap-drawer v0.22.1 (default light theme)
  • Official Layout Editor: my.glove80.com
  • ZMK Firmware: zmk.dev
  • Keymap Drawer: github.com/caksoylar/keymap-drawer

i3-like tiling window manager for macOS with multiple modes (main, service, resize).

docs.title: zsh
docs.text:
Shell configuration with vi mode, custom functions, and keybindings.

Configuration: zsh/.zshrc

docs.title: Custom Keybindings
docs.text: Shortcut Action Context Ctrl+F Open tmux-sessionizer Project Switching

docs.title: fzf Integration
docs.text:
Built-in fzf keybindings (loaded via source <(fzf --zsh)):

Shortcut Action Context Ctrl+R Search command history fzf Ctrl+T Search files in current directory fzf Alt+C Change directory (fuzzy) fzf

docs.title: Vi Mode
docs.text:
Vi mode enabled via zsh-vi-mode plugin:

Shortcut Action Context Esc Enter normal mode Vi Mode I Enter insert mode Vi Mode (from normal) V Edit command in editor Vi Mode (normal)

docs.title: Custom Functions
docs.text: Command Action Context killport <port> Kill process on specified port Utility Function y yazi wrapper (cd on exit) File Manager
